DOC.brief_summary: Magnesium deficiency is associated also in the elderly with low physical performance; nevertheless trials about the effect of supplementation of magnesium on physical performance are not available in old people. The aim of our study is to investigate whether 12-weeks of oral magnesium supplementation improves physical performance in healthy elderly women
DOC.brief_title: Assessment of Physical Performance After Oral Supplementation of Magnesium in a Sample of Old Women in Good Health
DOC.criteria: People over 65 years, not residents in nursing home, in good health previous supplementation of calcium, potassium or magnesium use of pump proton inhibitors or digitalis important comordidities such renal failure
